comments: Not sure why Mr. Gross has gotten so much flak on here. I thoroughly enjoyed his course, and looked forward to class. He is an outstanding professor with a vast wealth of knowledge, and stories. He teaches with enthusiasm, and passion. Encourages class participation, and always allows for questions. Open, laid back learning environment.

Unbelievably boring and the powerpoints are pointless and reiterate what is said in the text, verbatim. As someone who is interested in cultural anthropology, I was highly disappointed. I can\'t imagine what it must be like to not even want to take this class. Weekly quizzes only 5 questions. 4/5 on most quizzes = 80 in the class,essentially.

Gross is very passionate about his work and this makes class interesting. Most of your grade is based on weekly reading quizzes, five questions mostly on the bolded vocab and exams are basically an accumulation of this. He rambles and re-tells stories but overall its an easy A.

Cool teacher. Quizes on book chapters every monday. No mandatory attendance though. Exams are multiple choice and true false. Very detailed. A book paper and field trip paper. If you study for his tests, you can get a good grade. Puts his lectures online. He goes too fast in class so you can\'t write it down. Cool guy but sort of unreliable.

Super straightforward. Nice guy, if you ask him for help he loves to talk about the course. Goes off on a lot of strange examples. Offers extra credit on midterms. Just know the vocab, and you\'ll be fine. I recommend this class for anyone who needs GE credit or if they want to take an anthropology class.

Overall, its a super easy class. 2 midterms, 2 papers, final. His tests are straight out of the book and his Powerpoints. Sometimes he pulls the most random examples, but it doesn\'t hurt your grade much because he curves the entire class at the end of the semester. Papers are easy. He goes off on random tangents a lot, lots of stories.
Easy class. Exams are difficult but curved. Optional attendance. He can go off on tangents at times, but overall the class is very easy.

Very nice teacher. Goes off on tangeants that are sometimes pretty funny. Very easy class. Some questions on the tests are very specific though. But mostly, just read the book and you don\'t really even need to go to class.

Great teacher, super super helpful and one of the genuinely nicest teachers ive ever had. He loves anthropology and wants his students to find interest in it as well. I would definately reccomend this class its easy just review the powerpoints and read the book.

Went to this class 3.5 times, 2 midterms and a final and the other time I left halfway because it was unbearable. Very easy class, recommend taking it if you need credits. Just read the summary in the back of each chapter and you should be fine

This teacher does not clarify what needs to be on tests at all. Questions are unfair and tricky. He tends to go off on tangents and it is hard to know what is important. Coming to class is pointless (I did) because he goes through Power points way too fast. You basically have to teach yourself. DO NOT RECOMMEND! THIS CLASS WAS MISERABLE!
everything is right out of the book. if you read the book and know the definitions and concepts your fine. very nice guy. good class for GE credit

One of the nicest guys on campus! Very passionate about the course. Do the readings! He lectures off the book and does adds information that will be on tests so don\'t miss class either. The subject is not as exciting as you would think but he keeps it interesting with his personal stories.

I had no idea wht to expect from this class. But Prof Gross was fantastic! I wish he taught more than just archaeology and cultural anthropology! I think what made this class enjoyable for me were the stories about his travels, especially Egypt!

Prof Gross\' class in general is kind of boring. But it is a really easy A. You don\'t even really to go to class unless there is a test, something is due, there is a film you need to do a paper on. We only had one pop quiz. The tests are pretty easy. As long as you read the book and memorize definitions you should be fine.
